reviews.text: This is a lovely Days Inn, and goes above and beyond the quality of a normal Days Inn. There are several lodging options in Castle Rock and you should not dismiss the Days Inn. It is across the street from the outlet shopping mall and a short way up a winding road of hotel chains.
reviews.title: Nothing spectacular, but a good place to stay.

likes.liked: — Very clean, very well lighted, new feeling.
likes.disliked: — Basic accommodations, a little above average with appliances

reviews.text: There is an indoor pool + hot tub area, which is nothing fancy, but clean and adequate. I called them three times prior to arriving to double-check which room I was in, and asked them to move me to an area where I could see the parking lot. They were very gracious about it each time, and even upgraded me to a suite without my asking.
reviews.title: Nice for the Price

reviews.text: Loaction is ideal, right off I-25 next to the outlet malls. Room was clean and roomy, breakfast was the usual continental, nothing fancy or extensive, but enough to do the trick. Staff was helpful and nice. It is not "fancy" but then again it is a great bargain.
reviews.title: Great for the price
Stay somewhere else!
reviews.text: If you don't mind having your clothes stolen and being accused of lying by the manager, then stay here, otherwise there are much better choices in the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved a hotel for a night before a charity bicycling event (it begins at 6:30 am and is a bout 2 hours from our home).
reviews.title: Poor Management

likes.liked: — It was in the right town

reviews.text: When we checked in evrything seemed fine, lots of kids running around, though.
reviews.title: Decent, quiet, safe and convenient

likes.liked: — Easy access to highway, close to good food; easy stop between Denver Airport and Colorado Springs (less than 1 hour south from Castlerock)
likes.disliked: — The windows on the bottom floor -- despite being in a safe area, the windows seemed easy to break into

reviews.text: We got to our room and it simply reeked of cigarettes. Went back to the desk and asked for another room - they said they were booked up due to the bike event and a kids soccer tournament. Clerk offered us some Oust fabric spray. We called around, other hotels were full. We sprayed the room and when we left we noticed the "smoking" plaque on the door. We had specifically requested "non-smoking". Went BACK to desk, showed them the paperwork from hotels.com. They said "sorry, nothing we can do" claimed THEIR paperwork (which they wouldn't show us) had us in a SMOKING room.
reviews.title: Great for the price
